metadata.purpose: Structured insights from calibration battery for schema evolution

user_answers.audio_awareness: Almost never - audio doesn't register consciously
user_answers.theory: Audio quality connected to clips with good or intentional production quality. Videos with good composition, camera angles would also have good audio.

implications.new_signal: Add production_polish composite that includes audio intentionality

discovery.quantitative: hookStrength is NEGATIVE (r=-0.047), attentionRetention is TOP (+0.173)
discovery.meaning: Flashy openings hurt preference; sustained engagement wins

what_keeps_watching: Strong opening that promises something interesting
Curiosity about how premise will resolve
Feeling like each moment adds something
user_answers.desperate_vs_earned_hooks: POV text overlay that does too much, sets too much of the premise or overexplains. Subconsciously connected to low effort content that has premise setup entirely the first second, payoff within 3-7 seconds in unsophisticated way.
user_answers.good_hooks: Strong hook but allows slow burn tempo, with creative movements/beats, or good payoff. Depends on concept/premise/script quality or if core idea is original/unique.

implications.weight_adjustment: hookStrength should be neutral or negative weight

user_answers.what_counts_as_original: Subverts expectations, plays on good trope or cultural callback without being too obvious or straightforward. If joke feels like it's coming from miles away, hinders creativity feeling. Trope must be emotionally engaging.
user_answers.clever_vs_obvious: Simple premise (interrupted lunch) doesn't win prizes. Second video (dream state, biting colleague) has more cleverness due to implying story is set in another dimension.
user_answers.replicability_role: Matters for utility, not enjoyment. σTaste value includes what's valuable for service. Contains multitude of factors.

replicability_subfactors_identified: How easy to replicate by similar company
How much expected of characters (social risks, animated acting)
Amount of people, props, backdrops required
Can props/scenes be replaced or creatively altered
Concept too niche or alienating tone

discovery.quantitative: 49.1% notes mention humor, but no humor metric strongly predicts
discovery.hypothesis: Not IF funny, but HOW executed

user_answers.humor_type_preference: Every type can be fun. Makeup of what makes it good depends on what's happening in sketch.
user_answers.clever_vs_funny: Cleverness feels like positive surprise, too smart or well-thought out while seeming effortless. Goes against expectations while implying backstory/dynamic read between lines.
user_answers.example_clever: Worker checking with colleagues after stressful shift. One worker frozen filling cup, overflowing (shell-shocked). Plays on premise + war squad trope. Visual reveal is fun and unexpected.

implications.focus: Timing, construction, commitment level matter more than category

discovery.quantitative: 40.6% notes discuss payoff, but no payoff metric predicts directly
discovery.observation: attentionRetention (retention throughout) matters more than endpoint

user_answers.weak_payoff: Simple or obvious closure. Pre-recorded dub TikTok trends. Too abstract or unclear. Ending too obvious. Known trope with known beginning/middle/end.
user_answers.setup_payoff_relationship: It depends on content type. Prefer 7-25 seconds. Payoff doesn't need to be punchy/high energy but should close theme with meaningful ending.
user_answers.fast_food_analogy: 3-10 second concepts with big 'in your face' payoff aren't memorable. Delicious initial bite but no nutrition, feels flat/empty.

implications.rubric: Detect: closure_quality, surprise_fit, substance_level (empty_calories vs genuinely_clever)

faster_pacing_meaning: Intention behind editing signals professionalism/focus = quality
user_answers.too_fast: Hard to replicate due to editing difficulty. If concept leans on editing, trickier to replicate. More jarring to watch. Average business owner can't do professional editing.

implications.new_signal: Track editing intentionality not just speed
implications.replicability: Factor editing skill into replicability assessment

narrative_coherence.user_answer: Important to have sketch move in straight direction. Incrementally heighten emotional resonance, take joke further. Story moves forward with new developments in steady fashion.
narrative_coherence.example_steady: Manager watching → worker making mistakes. Engaging aspect is seeing new shots of unique absurdist mistakes. Steady stream of 'next thing'.
narrative_coherence.example_building: Restaurant payment argument. Dialogue gets more dynamic/high energy. Woman tries more ways to convince. Punchline: they're at different tables, don't know each other.
narrative_coherence.implication: Add narrative_flow with story_direction, beat_progression, momentum_type

performer_execution.user_answer: 50/50 premise vs performer. Performer can elevate or kill premise significantly.
performer_execution.what_makes_good_performer: Understanding voice as actor, what's implied about person. Animated facial expressions for physical comedy. Willingness to take social risks, show personality, be butt of joke. Must 'sell' concept with matching emotional undertones.
performer_execution.implication: Add performer_execution with concept_selling, social_risk, tonal_match

ai_accuracy.user_answer: Often wrong on many assessments. Mixed - accurate on some dimensions, wrong on others.
ai_accuracy.reliable: Objective values - production value, editing speed, hookStrength
ai_accuracy.unreliable: Subjective values like 'creativity'. Single number metrics for complex concepts.
ai_accuracy.implication: Use reasoning chains; don't rely on single scores for subjective qualities

sigma_taste_definition.user_answer: σTaste combines what's good for hagen service (what will sell) + subjective taste (what I feel is good). Not about max virality or max money.
sigma_taste_definition.category_issue: Some content isn't the 'type' looked for (informative video, interview, montage). Comparing across types is invalid.

four_categories: Good: Works in service context, has σTaste
Bad: Low quality but right type (can be improved)
Bad: Wrong type entirely (should be filtered)
Bad: Low quality AND wrong type

missing_factors.user_answer: Model should understand full conceptual ideas as human would. Creativity/originality/engagement/trope quality requires human-level understanding first.
missing_factors.strata_concept: Multiple layers/filters that make video fit within context. Within strata, sideways comparisons (same type, different category) or up/down (less good, same type).

part_8_meta.priority_addition: Strata - filter by type/context FIRST, then compare within categories
